Ethelbert P. Oliphant to Abraham Lincoln, 8 May 18491 I have the pleasure to be informed by your letter of Jany 24thult. that "it will afford you great pleasure to aid me with the matter I have in

view, to wit the charge toDenmark.2That aid would come very seasonably at this time, as I am about to visitWashington City, to see something in relation to that matter. If you and MrStuartcould feel at liberty to do me the favour to write toGenl. Taylor& forward it to him or theSecy of Statedirect from, your place, you will place me under lasting obligations.3
